required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I/II, First in Human, Dose Escalation Trial of TL 895 in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia or Relapsed/Refractory Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II, First in Human, Dose Escalation Trial of TL 895 in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory B-Cell Malignancies and Expansion in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia or Relapsed/Refractory Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this research study is to determine the safety and tolerability of TL-895. There are 2 parts of this study. Part 1 tested increasing doses of TL-895 to identify the recommended safe dose for participants with relapsed/refractory (R/R) B cell malignancies who failed at least 1 but no more than 3 prior therapies. Part 1 of this study is no longer enrolling participants.
Part 2 of this study will test different doses of TL-895 in participants with R/R CLL or SLL who have failed at least 1 prior therapy. Part 2 of this study is randomized (like the flip of a coin) to receive a specific treatment dose. If someone participates in Part 2, the dose they receive will be either 100mg twice a day or 150mg twice a day. Every participant in this study will receive TL-895.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1 (Dose Escalation): DLTs (Dose Limiting Toxicities) during Cycle 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to the end of cycle 1 (28 days)
primary_outcome.description: DLT is defined as any of the adverse event (AEs) of a certain grade or above, related to drug.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (2 years after last patient enrolled)
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving CR, CRi, nodular partial response (nPR), partial response (PR), or PR with lymphocytosis (PR-L) at any time while on the study based on iwCLL response criteria (2), as assessed by investigators

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 (Dose Escalation): Best Overall Response (BOR)/Progression Free Survival (PFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 6 months on treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by the length of time during the treatment of the disease, that a participant lives with the disease but it does not get worse based on investigator assessments

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (2 years after last patient enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects achieving CR/CRi based on iwCLL response criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (2 years after last patient enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Time from initial response to disease progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Number of Participants with Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (2 years after last patient enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence, nature, severity of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), and deaths, including cause of death, from screening up to the end of study visit of participants with CLL/SLL who have failed at least 1 line of therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Assessment of Safety and Tolerability via Clinical Measurements
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to end of study (2 years after last patient enrolled)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessments including but not limited to clinical laboratory measurements, ECGs, vital signs, and ECOG performance

clinical_study.condition: Mantle Cell Lymphoma and Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma

arm_group.description: Participants received TL-895 80 mg powder in capsule (PiC) orally once daily (OD) for 3 days followed by TL-895 160 mg OD in fasted state for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 300 mg PiC orally OD in fasted state for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 600 mg PiC orally OD in fasted state for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 300 mg PiC orally twice daily (BID) in fasted state for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 900 mg PiC orally QD in fasted state for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 100 mg BID orally BID with food for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.
Participants received TL-895 150 mg BID orally BID with food for 28 days in each 28 day cycle until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.

intervention.description: All participants will receive TL-895 at the dose assigned at enrollment until disease progression, withdrawal of consent, or discontinuation from the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Relapsed/refractory CLL or relapsed/refractory SLL
- ECOG performance status of ≤ 2
- Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal functions
Exclusion Criteria
- Prior treatment with any BTK or PI3K inhibitors
- History of major organ transplant
- Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding
